summary: Okay so I have to disagree with you on the theory that Dan's totally done with YouTube. Dan said in the Mukbang video that he's...
question: Okay so I have to disagree with you on the theory that Dan's totally done with YouTube. Dan said in the Mukbang video that he's "rapidly changing all the time." I feel like he's just not totally comfortable with himself rn and doesn't want to put out any solid thoughts, which could be related to "Trying to Live My Truth." He's probably trying to figure himself out and what he wants to do with his channel. Also, this year has been really taxing on d&p. (1)
answer:
“It takes him a lot of energy to make a video because he wants it to be perfect, and he hasn’t had the energy. I don’t think he’s done with YouTube, but if he does make a new video I do agree that it’ll definitely be much different than his past content. He’s changed so much in the past year. But YouTube is just such a big part of his life and I highly doubt he’d just drop it like that. He’s just putting himself first which is definitely what’s most important, but I’ll support him either way. (2)”


…


I do think that another part of it is that rapidly growing and changing thing. As well as the energy. I agree with everything you’ve said, but I still think he’s done. Like I’ve said in other asks, I don’t think he’s done with youtube entirely. Because he still seems to enjoy making content on the gaming channel and on amazingphil, but I think he’s done with solo content. Unless he gets a burst of energy and just needs to get something out there, I don’t think we’ll ever see regular, or even semi-regular videos from him again. I think we might get one or two videos in 2019, probably just him talking about his break and why he took it, etc. But I really and truly do believe that Dan’s channel and Dan’s solo content creation is done and over. But, I’m willing to be proven wrong.

summary: I so agree with you on following their friends and family. I follow Adrian because I actually like what he puts out, yes I knew...
question: I so agree with you on following their friends and family. I follow Adrian because I actually like what he puts out, yes I knew him because of Dan but that's not why I stayed. And I follow Cornelia because she's really cool and we're both Swedish so I can communicate with her in my own language which sometimes has a really familiar and nice feeling to it in such a global sphere as the internet.
answer: Exactly! I like following them, not because it’s a creepy “omg it’s Dan/Phil’s brother/aunt/whatever” but more in the sense that this is another creator that I enjoy, that I just so happened to discover through Dan and/or Phil. They’re all people I would have followed anyway, even if Dan and Phil weren’t in the equation at all.

reblog.comment: Exactly! I like following them, not because it’s a creepy “omg it’s Dan/Phil’s brother/aunt/whatever” but more in the sense that this is another creator that I enjoy, that I just so happened to discover through Dan and/or Phil. They’re all people I would have followed anyway, even if Dan and Phil weren’t in the equation at all.

summary: I’m ok with Dan not making videos again but I hope he doesn’t go away completely. He’s such a cool creative person and I’d love...
question: I’m ok with Dan not making videos again but I hope he doesn’t go away completely. He’s such a cool creative person and I’d love to support whatever he does next
answer: I don’t think he’s gonna disappear. He’ll hang around Phil’s channel and the gaming channel for a while, and maybe he’ll take on some kind of new project of some sort, but I really do think that the dinof channel/brand is just going to sit and gather dust from here on out.

reblog.comment: I don’t think he’s gonna disappear. He’ll hang around Phil’s channel and the gaming channel for a while, and maybe he’ll take on some kind of new project of some sort, but I really do think that the dinof channel/brand is just going to sit and gather dust from here on out.
